column4: Hi, I'm trying to do a few things — bought a laptop from best buy this evening, Windows 7 standard. I formatted the drive, installed ubuntu on a partition and formatted the other partition ntfs for windows. My laptop apparently has no XP chipset drivers for SATA so XP install is breaking when attempted. I think I found the drivers I need online, but they're windows executables — anyone have an idea what I should do, I've asked in #
Are you trying to put XP and Ubuntu on this new lappy?
yeah I am
ubuntu is already on and running fine as expected
I dont think you will find XP drivers for your laptop. But if Ubuntu is running fine no wories.
I did find the drivers
they're just .exe, and short of creating a windows install iso with them in there I dunno what to do
Then I am confused with what exactly you need assistance with...
you and me both ^^
I have not personally used that feature so I would not know.
What are you installing?
well, i've been trying to put XP on a partition, but as I said, no SATA chipset drivers — so I need to do something else
I have not yet figured out how to access files from VM to Host.
Restore partitions can be useful. But take up waaay too much space.
MS wont be supporting XP for much longer. I dont see how they can. It is sooo old.
bah, it's really just IE6+ i'm after
http://www.tatanka.com.br/ies4linux/page/Installation
ies4linux project still works, but it only installs IEs 5, 5.5, and 6 with an optional ie 7 alpha release — which isn't really too helpful these days
i'm a web developer, some clients have to have IE6 compatibility and IE7 because their companies won't let them upgrade
i would never … "use" .. internet exploder
Should have known. Companies would not allow FF for business use.
I was thinking more along the lines of shockwave support for some flash games or something. Either way.
